feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 4:26PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...TRACE ASHFALL POSSIBLE FOR FALSE PASS, COLD BAY, AND KING COVE DUE TO SHISHALDIN VOLCANIC ERUPTION... A plume from Shishaldin volcano is evident on satellite as the eruption continues this afternoon and will likely continue for many hours. A shifting wind profile aloft is taking the plume to the north in the low levels while shifting to the south aloft.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 2:26PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Hot And Dry Over Eastern Interior This Weekend... Hot and dry weather is expected for the Eastern Interior this weekend with temperatures rising into the 80s to lower 90s. Conditions are expected to become more smokey over the weekend as well. Temperature will remain the upper 70s and lower 80s on Monday.

entry.cap:areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 04 at 11:44AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cool Wet Pattern Continues Chances for Isolated Flooding and Flash Flooding... Localized flooding and flash flooding continues at the end of this week due to an active and moist storm track. High values of precipitable water (moisture) are presently over western, central, and northern Wyoming and are expected to continue through the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Big Horn; Fremont; Hot Springs; Johnson; Lincoln; Natrona; Park; Sublette; Sweetwater; Teton; Washakie
